description: Identifies a profile structure or implementation Guide that applies to the datatype this element refers to. If any profiles are specified, then the content must conform to at least one of them. The URL can be a local reference - to a contained StructureDefinition, or a reference to another StructureDefinition or Implementation Guide by a canonical URL. When an implementation guide is specified, the type SHALL conform to at least one profile defined in the implementation guide.

element.definition: Identifies a profile structure or implementation Guide that applies to the datatype this element refers to. If any profiles are specified, then the content must conform to at least one of them. The URL can be a local reference - to a contained StructureDefinition, or a reference to another StructureDefinition or Implementation Guide by a canonical URL. When an implementation guide is specified, the type SHALL conform to at least one profile defined in the implementation guide.
element.short: Profiles (StructureDefinition or IG) - one must apply

name: profile
publisher: Health Level Seven, Inc. - [WG Name] WG

constraint.expression: hasValue() or (children().count() > id.count()) or $this is Parameters
constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children unless an empty Parameters resource
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Profiles (StructureDefinition or IG) - one must apply

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Value of extension - must be one of a constrained set of the data types (see [Extensibility](extensibility.html) for a list).

title: Profile
